preview.text: You will only feel motivated enough to take steps towards your goal if the plan for achieving it will become clearer and clearer in your mind. For this, you just need to ask yourself on a regular basis: “what else can I do in order to reach my goal?”, add below some of the ideas that you come up with and act on them gradually.

main.text:
In order to achieve any goal, you need to generate a continuous stream of ideas, energy and confidence channeled towards that goal and the way to do this is very simple:
  • think about the moment in the future when your goal will become real
  • ask yourself on a regular basis (preferably at least once a day) "what else can I do in order to get there?"
  • put into practice the ideas that you come up with whenever you feel it’s appropriate to do so.

ideas.title: Why we get ideas
ideas.text:
Your subconscious mind is the warehouse of everything that you've seen, heard, felt, done, thought throughout your life and when you think about a clear goal and then you ask yourself "what else can I do in order to achieve it?", what happens is that you are gradually extracting ideas from this enormous warehouse of resources that you have at your disposal.

As you act on the ideas that you're getting, you put in new information because you see, hear, feel, do, think new things so the next time when you think again about your goal and the steps to achieve it, you get even more ideas and this is how the plan for achieving your goal becomes clearer and clearer in your mind and by taking the steps that are part of this plan, you get closer and closer to your goal.

energy.title: Why we get energy
energy.text:
The simple mental process of thinking about your goal and asking yourself "what else can I do in order to achieve it?" on a regular basis will gradually become a very powerful habit and because habits drive most of what we do, you will feel more and more energy for putting into practice the ideas that are part of your plan.

The reason for this is that the mental process goal/steps will gradually get transferred to your subconscious mind which will keep it running on auto-pilot, in the background, on an infinite loop and since this part of the mind is a tremendously powerful force that you have within yourself, any process that it keeps running in the background has the tendency of pushing the body to act according to the steps that are part of that process.

confidence.title: Why we get confidence
confidence.text: The subconscious mind cannot tell the difference between imagination and reality so if you think about your goal and the steps to achieve it on a regular basis, you’ll feel that you’ve already gone through this process in reality multiple times and this will give you more and more confidence that you’ll actually reach your goal.

extra_benefits.title: Extra benefits
extra_benefits.text:
In addition to the benefits mentioned previously, there are 3 other very important reasons for running the mental process goal/steps on a regular basis:
  • even when you don’t get new ideas, you will still generate more energy and confidence channeled towards your goal.
  • you’ll be able to figure out in advance many obstacles that you might encounter and this will give you enough time to prepare a plan B, plan C, etc. for those scenarios.
  • any change in the overall plan can lead to a significant change in the next immediate steps to follow.

preview.text: The only real problem you’ll encounter while planning and taking steps towards your goal will be the fact that at times you’ll get a bit impatient, frustrated, confused, bored, worried, stressed, etc. and it’s very important to relax quickly and efficiently in those moments.

main.text:
While pursuing your goals, you will inevitably encounter various negative states such as anger, frustration, discouragement, worry, boredom, stress etc. and the longer you let these negative states manifest themselves, the more you’ll lose patience, joy and efficiency and there’s also a very high chance that you’ll give up at some point.

The best thing to do in those moments is to relax efficiently because your body needs to feel good and relaxation is the most accessible feel-good state that we have at our disposal.

how_to_relax.title: How to relax
how_to_relax.text:
With your eyes open or closed, standing up, sitting on a chair or lying down, you just need to do the following:
  • think of the number 10 and focus on how you're letting the forehead relax
  • think of 9 and focus on how you’re letting the neck relax
  • think of 8 and focus on how you’re letting the shoulders relax
  • think of 7 and focus on how you’re letting the arms relax
  • ... and so on until you reach 1 and you focus on how you’re letting the feet relax
  • at the end you think of 0 and you keep focusing on how you're letting the entire body relax until you reach a really feel-good, relaxed state.
This last step is the most important one by far because from 10 to 1 you’re just preparing the body to relax and you should never expect to be relaxed enough by the time you get to 1. The real relaxation comes when you think of 0 and you keep focusing on how you’re letting the entire body relax until you get to that really feel-good, relaxed state.

Sometimes you’ll have to keep your focus there for a few seconds, other times for a few tens of seconds but you’ll notice that the more you focus on how you’re letting the entire body relax, the more relaxed your body will feel, which means that you have complete control over the degree of relaxation that you want to get to. And your goal should always be to get to that really feel-good, relaxed state whenever you use this method.

why_count_down.title: Why count down
why_count_down.text:
The negative states that you experience are actually caused by some negative thoughts which are either conscious or unconscious and what you need first and foremost in those moments is to direct your mind towards other thoughts, preferably positive ones.

This is not that easy to do though especially when you’re feeling very frustrated, angry, discouraged, stressed, etc. and that’s why numbers will work very well for this purpose as they are very clear, neutral thoughts which are guaranteed to take your mind away from the negative thoughts that have caused the negative states in the first place. And if with each number that you think of you also let a part of the body relax and at the end the entire body, you’ll be able to get to that nice, feel-good, relaxed state very quickly.

interruptions.title: Interruptions
interruptions.text: While doing this relaxation you’ll notice that various thoughts will distract you. All you need to do in those moments is to simply realize that you got interrupted and continue from the number where the interruption happened (if you remember it, if not you can just continue from any number you want). The important thing is to never go back from 10 because sometimes you’ll have so many interruptions that if you keep going back from 10 you’ll never be able to finish the relaxation process.

fast_slow_relaxation.title: Fast and slow relaxation
fast_slow_relaxation.text:
There’s a fast way and a slow way of doing this relaxation, the only difference between them being that in the slow version you have 3–4 second intervals between 10 and 9, 9 and 8 and so on, whereas in the fast version you do the countdown faster, without these intervals but in both versions the most important part remains what you do when you get to 0: keep focusing on how you’re letting the entire body relax until you reach that really feel-good, relaxed state.

The only part that's fast in the fast relaxation is the countdown from 10 to 1. Without doing the part at 0, the fast relaxation will never work and the slow one will only work very rarely.

when_to_relax.title: When to relax
when_to_relax.text:
The general rule of thumb is to do the fast relaxation immediately when you feel any negative state. Why immediately? Because the more you let any negative state manifest itself, the more you lose patience, joy and efficiency and any problem you encounter seems much bigger than it actually is.

There will be many times though when some negative states will keep coming back again and again and if you relax immediately in those moments it will feel more frustrating than relaxing. So only in those situations it’s best to let the negative emotions manifest themselves for a while and only then do the fast relaxation again.

If however you notice that some negative states keep coming back stronger and stronger and just by doing the fast relaxation you are not able to transition to a consistent feel-good state, then you need to take a bit more time to do the slow relaxation. This can happen anytime, anywhere but you’ll need at least 2–3 minutes of quiet time in order to do it efficiently.

You also need to keep in mind that if your body is in movement and you get into a negative state at some point, you have to stop the body first and only then relax.

preview.text: When you feel deeply engaged in any activity, you enjoy doing it much more and you are also very efficient at it. In order for this to happen, you just need to learn how to really focus on each and every step that you're taking.

main.text:
As you know from the relaxation method, when you get interrupted by various thoughts during the relaxation process you just need to realize that you got interrupted and continue from where you were when the interruption happened, and it will feel just as if nothing had interrupted you in the first place. It turns out that this method works amazingly well for any activity.

To give you an example, let’s say that you’re reading something and your mind starts drifting away at some point. When this happens, you just need to:
  • realize that you’re not focusing on the reading activity anymore
  • immediately switch your focus back to what you are reading.
If you do this every time you get distracted by other thoughts, you’ll notice how you will get more and more immersed in the reading activity and you’ll feel the pure joy of being there entirely. Reading is of course only one example and this will work just as well for any other activity.

in_your_head.title: In your head
in_your_head.text:
When you don't feel that much energy to take the next step towards you goal, you can do the following:
  • remind yourself of the final goal
  • review the main steps that you can take in order to reach it
  • do the activity which corresponds to the next step for 2-3 minutes in your head, applying the super-focus method to it: whenever you get interrupted by other thoughts, you just continue from where you got interrupted.
By doing this, you'll notice that when you take that next step in reality you'll feel much more focused and energized.

quiz_tutorial1.title: Mental process goal/steps
quiz_tutorial1.text:
We are helping our students achieve their professional goals by sharing with them our own knowledge and skills. At the same time however, they need to generate a continuous stream of ideas, energy and confidence channeled towards their goals and the way to do this is very simple: they just need to ask themselves on a regular basis (preferably at least once a day) "what else can I do in order to achieve my goal?" and put into practice the ideas that they come up with whenever they feel it’s appropriate to do so.

They get these ideas from the enormous warehouse of resources that we all have at our disposal which is the subconscious mind, and with each and every idea that they get, the plan for achieving their goals will become clearer and clearer in their minds.

quiz_tutorial2.title: Relaxation method
quiz_tutorial2.text:
While pursuing their goals, our students will inevitably experience various negative states such as anger, frustration, discouragement, worry, boredom, stress etc. and the longer they let these negative states manifest themselves, the more they will lose patience, joy and efficiency and there’s also a very high chance that they will give up at some point.

The best thing they can do in those moments is to relax efficiently because the body needs to feel good and relaxation is the most accessible feel-good state that we all have at our disposal.

For relaxing, we teach them a very simple method: they have to count down from 10 to 1, letting each part of the body relax from head to toes and very importantly, when they get to 0 they have to keep focusing on how they're letting the entire body relax until they reach a very relaxed, feel-good state.

quiz_tutorial3.title: Super-focus method
quiz_tutorial3.text:
While planning and taking steps towards their goals, our students will also get distracted by various thoughts which will prevent them from keeping their focus on the tasks at hand. What they need to do in those moments is to simply realize that they got distracted and immediately switch their focus back to the steps that they are taking.

If they do this every time they get distracted by other thoughts, they will notice how they will become more and more immersed in each and every step that they are taking and they will feel the pure joy of being there entirely.

quiz_tutorial4.title: Getting ideas
quiz_tutorial4.text:
The main benefit of asking themselves each and every day "what else can I do in order to achieve my goal?" is the fact that our students will be able to build a clearer and clearer plan in their minds for reaching their goals. That's because when they ask themselves this very simple yet extremely powerful question, what they actually do is that they keep searching for ideas in their subconscious mind, which is the warehouse of everything that they’ve seen, heard, felt, done and thought throughout their lives.

This mental process is actually very similar to what they do in order to complete short-term tasks, the only difference being that they are applying it for achieving medium to long-term goals such as "I want to land a job in my field of interest."

quiz_tutorial5.title: Interruptions during relaxation
quiz_tutorial5.text:
While practicing the 10-to-0 relaxation method, our students will notice that various thoughts will distract them. All they need to do in those moments is to simply realize that they got interrupted and continue from the number where the interruption happened (if they remember it, if not they can just continue from any number they wish).

The important thing is to never go back from 10 because sometimes there will be many interruptions and if they keep going back from 10, they will never be able to finish the relaxation process.

quiz_tutorial6.title: Fast and slow relaxation
quiz_tutorial6.text:
There’s a fast and a slow way of doing the 10-to-0 relaxation, the only difference between them being that in the slow version there should be a 3–4 seconds interval between 10 and 9, 9 and 8 and so on, whereas in the fast version we do the countdown faster. In both versions however, the most important part remains what we do when we get to 0: keep focusing on how we're letting the entire body relax until we reach that really feel-good, relaxed state.

It's best for our students to start by practicing the slow relaxation but gradually they should get to the point where they are using the fast version more often.

quiz_tutorial7.title: Energy
quiz_tutorial7.text:
By asking themselves on a regular basis "what else can I do in order to achieve my goal?", our students won't get only ideas but they will also generate more and more energy to act on those ideas because the mental process goal/steps will gradually get transferred to their subconscious minds, which will keep it running on auto-pilot, in the background, on an infinite loop.

The subconscious mind is a tremendously powerful force that we have within ourselves and any process that it keeps running in the background has the tendency of pushing the body in the direction of the goal which is at the end of that process.

quiz_tutorial8.title: Confidence
quiz_tutorial8.text:
Apart from ideas and energy, our students will also get more and more confidence that they can reach their goals whenever they keep asking themselves "what else can I do in order to achieve my goal?"

This will happen because the subconscious mind simply cannot tell the difference between imagination and reality, which means that for any process that we run in our minds, we feel that we’ve already gone through that process in reality multiple times and this gives us more and more confidence that we’ll actually reach our goals.

quiz_tutorial9.title: Internal super-focus
quiz_tutorial9.text:
We also teach our students a very useful application of the super-focus method, which allows them to pump more energy into the next step that they want to take. All they need to do is the following: think of their final goal and some of the main steps to achieve it, then think about the desired outcome of the step that they will take in the next 1 hour or so and some of the actions that will be part of this step.

While going through this entire thinking process, they also need to apply the super-focus method (whenever their mind gets distracted, continue from where the interruption happened) until the body becomes very comfortable with the process.

quiz_tutorial10.title: Ideas, energy and confidence
quiz_tutorial10.text:
To recap, we encourage our students to keep asking themselves on a regular basis "what else can I do in order to achieve my goal?" so that they can build a clearer and clearer plan in their minds for achieving their goals.

At the same time, this very simple yet extremely powerful question will allow them to generate more and more energy and confidence to put their ideas into practice because their subconscious minds will keep the process running on auto-pilot in the background, and it will also reinforce the feeling that they've already taken all the steps and achieved their goals multiple times in the past.

quiz_tutorial11.title: Fast and slow relaxation
quiz_tutorial11.text:
Relaxation is very useful whenever our students feel discouraged, frustrated, worried, stressed, confused, etc. while pursuing their goals. The 10-to-0 relaxation method that we teach them is practiced by counting down from 10 to 0, letting each part of the body relax from head to toes and keeping in mind that the most important part is the final one: when they get to 0, they have to keep focusing on how they're letting the entire body relax until they reach that really feel-good, relaxed state.

If they get interrupted by other thoughts during the relaxation process, they should just continue from the number where the interruption happened, and they should also gradually get to the point where they are using the fast relaxation more often than the slow one (1 second intervals or less between the numbers rather than 3-4 seconds).

quiz_tutorial12.title: Super-focus method
quiz_tutorial12.text:
The super-focus method allows our students to immerse themselves more and more fully in each and every step that they are taking and it's just about realizing when they get distracted by other thoughts and switching their focus back to the activity at hand.

This method can also be applied for pumping more energy into the next steps that they want to take: they just have to think about the final goal, the overall plan to achieve it, and the immediate next steps, and apply the super-focus method while doing all of this, until the body becomes very comfortable with the entire thinking process.

quiz_tutorial11.title: Fast and slow relaxation
quiz_tutorial11.text:
Relaxation is very useful whenever you feel discouraged, frustrated, worried, stressed, confused, etc. while pursuing your goals. The 10-to-0 relaxation method is practiced by counting down from 10 to 0, letting each part of the body relax from head to toes and keeping in mind that the most important part is the final one: when you get to 0, you have to keep focusing on how you're letting the entire body relax until you reach that really feel-good, relaxed state.

If you get interrupted by other thoughts during the relaxation process, you should just continue from the number where the interruption happened, and you should also gradually get to the point where you are using the fast relaxation more often than the slow one (1 second intervals or less between the numbers rather than 3-4 seconds).

quiz_tutorial12.title: Super-focus method
quiz_tutorial12.text:
The super-focus method allows you to immerse yourself more and more fully in each and every step that you are taking and it's just about realizing when you get distracted by other thoughts and switching your focus back to the activity at hand.

This method can also be applied for pumping more energy into the next steps that you want to take: you just have to think about the final goal, the overall plan to achieve it, and the immediate next steps, and apply the super-focus method while doing all of this, until the body becomes very comfortable with the entire thinking process.

privacy.title: Privacy policy
privacy.text:
Mentors Without Borders (“we” or “us” or “our”) respects the privacy of our users (“user” or “you”). This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, disclose, and safeguard your information when you visit our mobile application (the “Application”). Please read this Privacy Policy carefully. IF YOU DO NOT AGREE WITH THE TERMS OF THIS PRIVACY POLICY, PLEASE DO NOT ACCESS THE APPLICATION.

We reserve the right to make changes to this Privacy Policy at any time and for any reason. We will alert you about any changes by updating the “Last updated” date of this Privacy Policy. You are encouraged to periodically review this Privacy Policy to stay informed of updates. You will be deemed to have been made aware of, will be subject to, and will be deemed to have accepted the changes in any revised Privacy Policy by your continued use of the Application after the date such revised Privacy Policy is posted.

This Privacy Policy does not apply to the third-party online/mobile store from which you install the Application, which may also collect and use data about you. We are not responsible for any of the data collected by any such third party.

COLLECTION OF YOUR INFORMATION
We may collect information about you in a variety of ways. The information we may collect via the Application depends on the content and materials you use, and includes:

Personal Data
Demographic and other personally identifiable information (such as your name and email address) that you voluntarily give to us when choosing to participate in various activities related to the Application, such as scheduling lessons, chatting, sending feedback, etc. If you choose to share data about yourself via your profile or other interactive areas of the Application, please be advised that all data you disclose in these areas is public and your data will be accessible to anyone who accesses the Application.

Derivative Data
Information our servers automatically collect when you access the Application, such as your native actions that are integral to the Application, including posting and accepting lesson requests, canceling lessons, adding lesson notes, goals and steps, and solving quizzes.

Geo-Location Information
We may request access or permission to and track location-based information from your mobile device, either continuously or while you are using the Application, to provide location-based services. If you wish to change our access or permissions, you may do so in your device’s settings.

Mobile Device Access
We may request access or permission to certain features from your mobile device, including your mobile device’s calendar, camera, contacts, reminders, storage, and other features. If you wish to change our access or permissions, you may do so in your device’s settings.

Mobile Device Data
Device information such as your mobile device ID number, model, and manufacturer, version of your operating system, phone number, country, location, and any other data you choose to provide.

Push Notifications
We may request to send you push notifications regarding your account or the Application. If you wish to opt-out from receiving these types of communications, you may turn them off in your device’s settings.

Third-Party Data
Information from third parties, such as personal information or network friends, if you connect your account to the third party and grant the Application permission to access this information.

USE OF YOUR INFORMATION
Having accurate information about you permits us to provide you with a smooth, efficient, and customized experience. Specifically, we may use information collected about you via the Application to:
  1. Create and manage your account.
  2. Compile anonymous statistical data and analysis for use internally.
  3. Assist law enforcement and respond to subpoena.
  4. Email you regarding your account.
  5. Enable user-to-user communications.
  6. Generate a personal profile about you to make future visits to the Application more personalized.
  7. Increase the efficiency and operation of the Application.
  8. Monitor and analyze usage and trends to improve your experience with the Application.
  9. Notify you of updates to the Application.
  10. Request feedback and contact you about your use of the Application.
  11. Resolve disputes and troubleshoot problems.
  12. Send you a newsletter.
  13. Solicit support for the Application.

DISCLOSURE OF YOUR INFORMATION
We may share information we have collected about you in certain situations. Your information may be disclosed as follows:

By Law or to Protect Rights
If we believe the release of information about you is necessary to respond to legal process, to investigate or remedy potential violations of our policies, or to protect the rights, property, and safety of others, we may share your information as permitted or required by any applicable law, rule, or regulation.

Third-Party Service Providers
We may share your information with third parties that perform services for us or on our behalf, including data analysis, email delivery and hosting services.

Interactions with Other Users
If you interact with other users of the Application, those users may see your name and other information that we consider to be relevant as part of this interaction.

Online Postings
When you post comments, contributions or other content to the Application, your posts may be viewed by all users.

Analytics
We may also partner with selected third-party vendors, such as Google Analytics, Mixpanel, and others, to allow tracking services on the Application to, among other things, analyze and track users’ use of the Application, determine the popularity of certain content, and better understand online activity. By accessing the Application, you consent to the collection and use of your information by these third-party vendors.

SECURITY OF YOUR INFORMATION
We use administrative, technical, and physical security measures to help protect your personal information. While we have taken reasonable steps to secure the personal information you provide to us, please be aware that despite our efforts, no security measures are perfect or impenetrable, and no method of data transmission can be guaranteed against any interception or other type of misuse. Any information disclosed online is vulnerable to interception and misuse by unauthorized parties. Therefore, we cannot guarantee complete security if you provide personal information.

POLICY FOR CHILDREN
We do not knowingly solicit information from or market to children under the age of 13. If you become aware of any data we have collected from children under age 13, please contact us using the contact information provided below.

OPTIONS REGARDING YOUR INFORMATION
Account Information
You may at any time review or change the information in your account or terminate your account by:
  • Logging into your account settings and updating your account
  • Contacting us using the contact information provided below
Upon your request to terminate your account, we will deactivate or delete your account and information from our active databases. However, some information may be retained in our files to prevent fraud, troubleshoot problems, assist with any investigations and/or comply with legal requirements.

Emails and Communications
If you no longer wish to receive correspondence, emails, or other communications from us, you may opt-out by contacting us using the contact information provided below.

CALIFORNIA PRIVACY RIGHTS
If you are under 18 years of age, reside in California, and have a registered account with the Application, you have the right to request removal of unwanted data that you publicly post on the Application. To request removal of such data, please contact us using the contact information provided below, and include the email address associated with your account and a statement that you reside in California. We will make sure the data is not publicly displayed on the Application, but please be aware that the data may not be completely or comprehensively removed from our systems.

CONTACT US
